questions.text: A radiologist is worried about the effects of her job involving radiation on the prenatal uterine development of her baby. In which one of the following periods is the fetus most susceptible to influences of the environment that could result in the occurrence of non-lethal congenital abnormalities?

options.label: A
options.text: 1 week of fetal life to the 2nd week

questions.text: A 50 year old man, who has a habit of drinking six cans of beer a day and an increased intake on 'special days' and holidays presents to the OPD for a routine checkup. On investigation, an abnormal plasma lipoprotein profile is found. Erythrocyte fluidity is changed in liver disease, which explains this finding. Which one of the following would increase this membrane fluidity in this man's liver hepatocytes?

options.label: A
options.text: The binding of an antibody to a receptor on the cell surface

options.label: B
options.text: Transmembrane lipid bilayer movement of phospholipids

options.label: C
options.text: Raised cholesterol to phospholipids ratio of the plasma membrane

options.label: D
options.text: The binding of cytoskeleton elements with integral membrane proteins

questions.correct_answer: A. The binding of an antibody to a receptor on the cell surface

questions.text: There is a linkage in the intermediate filament network of cells to the lamina basale. This linkage is done by:
A loss-of-function mutation in integrin expression on the lymphocytes causes certain disorders. These disorders would most likely result in which of the following?
Which of the following inhalational anesthetics accumulates in air-filled cavities during general anesthesia?

A man, 60 years old, presented with lymphadenopathy, splenomegaly, fever, night sweats and loss of weight. BMA and biopsy were recommended. Which one of the following is the best place for a bone marrow sampling in this patient?
Which statement regarding local anesthetics is true?

options.label: A
options.text: When used for infiltration anesthesia, the maximal safe total dose of lidocaine is 3.0 mg per kilogram of body weight

options.label: B
options.text: Addition of epinephrine to solutions of lidocaine, procaine, or bupivacaine does not increase the maximal safe total dose but increases the duration of the block

options.label: C
options.text: Numerous individuals are hyper- sensitive to local anesthetics

options.label: D
options.text: Rapid systemic administration of local anesthetics may cause death without signs of CNS stimulation

questions.correct_answer: D. Rapid systemic administration of local anesthetics may cause death without signs of CNS stimulation

questions.text: There exists a minimal blood-air barrier in the lungs. Which one of the following is a part of this pulmonary barrier?

options.label: A
options.text: Fusion of basal laminae of endothelial and epithelial cells

questions.correct_answer: A. Fusion of basal laminae of endothelial and epithelial cells

questions.text: Critically-ill patients warrant the frequent use of dopamine, because:

options.label: A
options.text: It increases splanchnic flow, at high doses

options.label: B
options.text: It increases coronary flow, at high doses

options.label: C
options.text: It decreases heart rate, at low doses

options.label: D
options.text: It lowers peripheral resistance, at low doses

questions.correct_answer: B. It increases coronary flow, at high doses

questions.text: Which one of the following is true for both he cells comprising the enteric nervous system of the gut and the enteroendocrine cells?

options.label: A
options.text: Both are derived from neural crest

options.label: D
options.text: Both are found only in small intestine

questions.text: A 21-year-old paraplegic patient is given succinylcholine, during intubation. The patient appears to demonstrate fasciculations, the vocal cords are easily visualized with a laryngoscope with the subsequent placement of the ET tube. Peaked T waves and intermittent ectopy are noted on the ECG. What is the most appropriate first step in this patient's management?
During re-epithelialization, naturally occurring, nonpathologic cervical erosions are usually corrected. In which one of the following reproductive classes of women are these erosions most common?
A tumor in the infratemporal fossa may gain entrance to the orbit through which of the following?
Which one of the folliowing is involved in pain that is referred to the right side of the neck and extends laterally from the right clavicle to the tip of the right shoulder?

A 14 year old girl is hospitalized for evaluation of a possible seizure disorder because she has staring spells, lethargy, and irritability twice/ day. A 24-hour EEG shows diffuse epileptic foci that develop 4-6 hours after feeding, and low serum glucose is noted during these periods. Of the following dietary supplements, which might help this child?

A 22 year old male consults a physician because his father and a paternal aunt developed colon cancer in their mid-20s. Neither relative had multiple colonic polyps, so a diagnosis of HNPCC is considered. Many gene regions in HNPCC contain abnormal, small loops of unpaired DNA. These small DNA loops are the result of a mutation affecting which one of the following?
High-energy phosphate-bond equivalents are utilized in the process of activation of amino acids for protein synthesis. Choose the number of these bond equivalents?

A 30 year old patient recently underwent a surgery and postoperative recovery which resulted in the compression of the peroneal nerve against the fibular head. This compression would result in which of the following motor deficits?

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of flexion at the knee

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of medial rotation of the tibia

questions.text: What is the probable inheritance pattern in a family with Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT) where restriction analysis using sites flanking the CMT gene on chromosome 17 yields one large abnormal fragment and one smaller fragment that is seen in controls?

A 13 year old girl presented to the OPD with tremors. On examination, she was found to have golden brown discoloration of the Descemet’s membrane. Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A patient, with a history of a hyper mature cataract, presented to the ER with a sudden onset left eye pain. He appeared to have redness and photophobia in the left eye. There was increased IOP in a deep anterior chamber in the left eye. The right eye appeared normal. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?
Which of the following causative agents is responsible for the occurrence of delayed onset endophthalmitis after a cataract surgery?

An 8 year old boy is brought to the clinic by his parents with complaints of flu like symptoms, malaise and general weakness. He has a history of repeated and recurrent infections since the first year of life and the symptoms persist for a certain amount of time. Further examinations reveal enlargement of the liver and spleen with lymph node inflammation. On physical examination, there was a superficial rash resembling eczema. Laboratory results showed the neutrophils count is impaired. What might be the most likely cause of the child’s illness?
On examination of a 2 year old child with leukocoria, a large unilateral retinoblastoma filling half the globe is found. Which of the following is the most appropriate management in this patient?

A 67 year old female is brought to the emergency room by her grandson as she had developed bruising covering many areas of her body. The grandmother lives by herself and is not so attentive about her food and diet. On physical examination, small blood clots around hair follicles are visible, some of these follicles having a“corkscrew” appearance. Also there is gingival swelling,tenderness and bleeding. The above mentioned condition could be as a result of which deficiency of which vitamin ?

A man presented to the OPD, and with complaints of constant ringing in his ears. He appeared to have skin depigmentation. On further examination, bilateral uveitis was found. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis that encompasses the stated features?
Toll like receptors recognize bacterial products & stimulate immune response by:

options.label: C
options.text: Transcriptions of nuclear factor mediated by NFKb which recruits cytokines

questions.correct_answer: C. Transcriptions of nuclear factor mediated by NFKb which recruits cytokines

questions.text: A patient presented with symptoms of watering from his left eye since a year. A patent drainage system was revealed on syringing examination. The rest of his ocular examination was normal. A provisional diagnosis of a lacrimal pump failure was made. The confirmation of this diagnosis would be done by which of the following methods?

A 26-year-old woman presents because of trouble with her vision. Physical examination reveals a very tall, thin woman with long, thin fingers. Examining her eyes reveals the lens of her left eye to be in the anterior chamber. Her blood levels of methionine and cystathionine are within normal levels. These signs and symptoms are caused by?
Which one of the following is the accurate definition of a ‘cross-cylinder’?

options.label: A
options.text: One spherical and one cylindrical lens

questions.correct_answer: A. One spherical and one cylindrical lens

questions.text: A 37-year-old man, Gagan presents with increasing abdominal pain and jaundice. He gives a history of intake of groundnuts which did not taste appropriate. Physical examination reveals a large mass involving the right side of his liver, and a biopsy specimen from this mass confirms the diagnosis of liver cancer (hepatocellular carcinoma). Which of the following substances is associated with the pathogenesis of this tumor?
Lamina cribrosa is mesh-like structure that surrounds and supports the optic nerve head with the retinal ganglion. It is absent in which one of the following disorders?

A 7-month-old baby boy is evaluated because of repeated episodes of pneumococcal pneumonia. Serum studies demonstrate very low levels of IgM, IgG, and IgA. This condition of the patient is thought to be related to a deficiency of which of the following proteins?

options.label: C
options.text: Gamma chain of the IL-2 receptor

questions.text: Rahul Kumar Singh migrates from UP to Bihar to work under the NREGA scheme as a daily wage labourer. The district has high malaria endemicity. So, his physician gives him primaquine chemoprophylaxis for Plasmodium vivax malaria. Several days after beginning such a regimen,he develops anemia, hemoglobinemia, and hemoglobinuria. Special studies will likely reveal an abnormality in which of the following?
During a summer camp, multiple children had to be hospitalized with symptoms resembling the ingestion of botulinum toxins. The effects of this toxin includes which one of the following?

A 6 year old child presents with pallor that required two blood transfusions previously. He has now developed fever and petechial haemorrhages. His hemoglobin is 9 g/dL, platelet count is 20,000/mm3 and TLC is 60,000/ mm3. Flow cytometry reveals the cells to be CD10+ve, MPO+ve,CD19+ve,CD33–ve,CD117+ve,and CD3 – ve. Which is the most likely diagnosis?

Wblood sample is taken from a patient as a baseline measurement after which Drug A is administered intravenously. Additional blood samples are taken periodically and the drug concentration is measured in each blood sample. This sampling is repeated, with oral drug administration this time. A logarithm of drug concentration v/s time is plotted from data from both administration routes. Comparable elimination 'curves' indicative of first-order kinetic elimination is indicated. What do the slopes of the resulting concentration vs. time curves tell us best about the pharmacokinetics of Drug A?

A 28 year old woman presents to OPD complaining of nosebleeds. She also has easy bruising and excessively heavy bleeding during her periods. There is no history of drug intake. Physical examination shows scattered petechiae with normal sized spleen. Laboratory examination shows platelet count of 37000/microliter and a bleeding time of 16 minutes. The bone marrow sometimes shows an increased number of megakaryocytes. Antinuclear antibodies are negative. Autoantibodies that are directed against which of the following antigens would likely be found in this patient’s serum?

A drug user self-administers cocaine. This causes him to experience significant changes in cardiovascular changes and CNS- stimulating effects for which the drug is used. Which one of the following listed answers is the most likely mechanism by which cocaine causes its main peripheral and CNS effects?

options.label: A
options.text: Activation of α2-adrenergic receptors leading to increased NE release

options.label: B
options.text: Blockage of NE reuptake via the amine pump

options.label: C
options.text: Direct activation postsynaptic α- and β-adrenergic receptors, leading to sympathomimetic (adrenomimetic) responses

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibition of MAO, leading to increased intraneuronal NE levels

questions.correct_answer: B. Blockage of NE reuptake via the amine pump

questions.text: A 30 year old male with exertional calf pain and painful foot ulcers demonstrates hypersensitivity to intradermally injected tobacco extract. Which of the following pathologic processes is most likely responsible for this patient’s condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Onion-like concentric thickening of arteriolar walls

options.label: C
options.text: Transmural inflammation of the arterial wall with fibrinoid necrosis

options.label: D
options.text: Segmental vasculitis extending into contiguous veins and nerves

questions.correct_answer: D. Segmental vasculitis extending into contiguous veins and nerves

questions.text: A 40 year old woman with diagnosed myasthenia gravis presents with profound skeletal muscle weakness. It is unsure whether she is experiencing a cholinergic crisis or a myasthenic crisis, so an appropriate dose of parenteral edrophonium is administered. Assuming that the patient was actually experiencing a cholinergic crisis, which of the following is the most likely response to the drug?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypertensive crisis from peripheral vascular constriction

questions.text: Identify the drug that is suitable for topical administration (e.g., to mucous membranes), but cannot be given parenterally because of its physicochemical properties, which render it very poorly soluble.
Which of the following drugs would be most suitable in the outpatient prophylaxis of a patient with recurring periodic episodes of PSVT?

A 63 year old woman, normotensive, is transferred to the surgical ICU after cardiac surgery. She has diffuse rales bilaterally, pulse = 110/min, a raised venous pressure, and BP = 165/95 mm Hg. An incorrect syringe that contains the wrong drug is given to this patient to control her heart rate and blood pressure. The patient’s pulse rate increases to 150/min and her blood pressure is now 185/107 mmHg. Which of the following drugs was likely to be given?

A patient, who has been taking an oral diuretic for the past 6 months, presents with a raised fasting and postprandial blood glucose levels. His HbA1c levels are also elevated compared to his previous normal baseline values of 6 months ago. His glycemic problems are suspected to be diuretic-induced. Which one of the following is the most likely cause?
A 24 year old patient with asthma is being treated with a drug called montelukast. Which one of the following is the main mechanism by which this drug functions?

options.label: A
options.text: Blocking of the proinflammatory effects of some arachidonic acid metabolites

options.label: B
options.text: Enhanced release of epinephrine from the adrenal medulla

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibition of cAMP breakdown, via phosphodiesterase inhibition

questions.correct_answer: A. Blocking of the proinflammatory effects of some arachidonic acid metabolites

questions.text: A patient presents to the OPD with a rich history of frequent and moderately severe migraine headaches. When 'sumatriptan', a commonly used drug for abortive therapy is given, which one of the following 'local control substances' does it mainly act on?

Fat-soluble vitamins, compared with their water-soluble counterparts, usually have a greater potential toxicity to the user when taken in excess. Which one of the following most accurately states the focal reason for this finding?

options.label: D
options.text: Involved in more essential metabolic pathways

questions.correct_answer: B. Avidly stored by the body

questions.text: A few patients, who are taking high doses of a bisphosphonate for Paget’s disease of the bone develop an endocrine-metabolic disorder. Which one of the following is the most likely disorder?

A 60 year old security guard presents to the his physician because he is having malaise, fever and weakness. On taking history, a positive history of multiple episodes of passage of altered colored urine is present. However, this is not associated with urinary frequency, dysuria, or nocturia. Physical examination is insignificant but his urine analysis reveals 4 + hematuria; 1 + proteinuria and absence of glucose or ketones by the dipstick method. Which of the following is the next most appropriate step for the management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Abdominal CT scan for renal mass

options.label: C
options.text: Collection of a 24 hour urine specimen for protein

questions.correct_answer: B. Abdominal CT scan for renal mass

questions.text: A patient presented to the ER with symptoms of a fine tremor in their hands and fingers, heat sensitivity and moist skin. He complained of a faster, irregular heartbeat and appeared to have and enlarged goiter on examination, with bulged, swollen eyes. A provisional diagnosis was made. This diagnosis follows a possible pathogenesis of which of the following options?
questions.explanation:
Binds Tissue ↑ Stimulation of receptor
To ↓ Stimulation of receptor

questions.text: The depicted image is from a liver biopsy of a 34-year-old woman with a long history of alcoholism. Which of the following explains the changes shown here most appropriately?

options.label: B
options.text: Apoptosis with a replacement of damaged cells by lipid-laden macrophages

options.label: C
options.text: Bilirubin accumulation with mobilization of fat by bile salts

questions.correct_answer: A. Accumulation of triglycerides within hepatocytes

questions.text: An 8-year-old girl is diagnosed with ALL. Which of the following cytogenetic changes would show a good prognosis?
Which of one the following conditions best describes the mechanism through which Fas(CD95) initiates apoptosis?
The most important characteristic of a water-insoluble substance that governs its diffusibility through a cell membrane is its:

A 28 year old woman cones to the OPD with complains of slightly increased vaginal discharge since 1 month. A cervical Pap smear is shown below. Superficial epithelial cells are identified with the arrows. When compared to the cells from the deeper intermediate layer (top), the nuclei of these superficial cells may exhibit which of the following cytologic features?
Which of the following is the best index of preload?
A first-degree heart-block is diagnosed through which of the following findings?

options.label: A
options.text: The PR interval of the ECG is increased

options.label: B
options.text: The P wave of the ECG is never followed by a QRS complex

options.label: C
options.text: The P wave of the ECG is sometimes followed by a QRS complex

options.label: D
options.text: The T wave of the ECG is inverted

questions.correct_answer: A. The PR interval of the ECG is increased

questions.text: Cross-sectional studies are usually based on primary data, collected by the interviewer himself. It is a constituent of which one of the following?
Which of the following is the most dependant factor for the percentage of the total cardiac output distributed to any single organ?

options.label: D
options.text: Ratio of an organ’s vascular resistance to total peripheral resistance

questions.correct_answer: D. Ratio of an organ’s vascular resistance to total peripheral resistance

questions.text: The theory of ‘Disease causation’ is best described by which one of the following:

options.label: A
options.text: heory of one-to-one relationship between causal agent and disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Multi-factorial theory of disease causation

questions.text: Regarding small intestinal motility, which one of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Contractile activity: initiated in response to bowel wall distention

options.label: B
options.text: Peristalsis: major contractile pattern during feeding

options.label: C
options.text: Migrating motor complexes: occur during the digestive period

options.label: D
options.text: Vagotomy: abolishes contractile activity during the digestive period

questions.correct_answer: A. Contractile activity: initiated in response to bowel wall distention

questions.text: Supposing randomisation is done in a controlled clinical trial to determine a comparison between two treatment groups, the main purpose of this randomisation would be:

options.label: A
options.text: The allocation of participants in each treatment group is independent of the clinician’s control

options.label: B
options.text: The sample can be referenced to a known population.

options.label: C
options.text: The treatments received by each subject can be predicted by the clinician.

options.label: D
options.text: The two groups will have the same prognostic factors.

questions.correct_answer: A. The allocation of participants in each treatment group is independent of the clinician’s control

questions.text: Which of the following statements about medium-chain fatty acids is accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: More water-soluble than long-chain fatty acids

options.label: B
options.text: Used for triglyceride resynthesis, within the enterocyte

questions.correct_answer: A. More water-soluble than long-chain fatty acids

questions.text: A host in which the organism is alive, without further development, is which one of the following:
All of the following statements are true regarding Amphixenoses, except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is a disease, which is epidemic in bird populations.

options.label: B
options.text: It is maintained in both humans and lower vertebrates.

options.label: C
options.text: It is displayed by Trypanosoma cruzi.

options.label: D
options.text: It can be transmitted in both directions between its vectors.

questions.correct_answer: B. It is maintained in both humans and lower vertebrates.

questions.text: A patient, with raised basal and maximal acid outputs, reduced serum calcium levels and microcytic anemia, would be found to have which area of the GIT inflamed?
Which of the following does herd immunity threshold NOT vary with?

options.label: A
options.text: The vaccine efficacy for the disease

options.label: B
options.text: The number of vaccines available for the disease

options.label: C
options.text: The documented virulence of the disease

questions.correct_answer: B. The number of vaccines available for the disease

questions.text: Precurrent disinfection includes which of the following examples:
A student presented to the ER with a two-day history of severe vomiting and orthostatic hypotension. What kind of metabolic abnormalities be expected?

options.label: C
options.text: Normal serum electrolytes and metabolic acidosis

options.label: D
options.text: Normal serum electrolytes and metabolic alkalosis

questions.text: The difference in time between the first point of diagnosis and the critical point of diagnosis is known as:
Identify the wrong pair among the following:

options.label: A
options.text: Propagative transmission - Plague Bacilli in rat fleas

options.label: B
options.text: Cyclo developmental transmission - Microfilaria in mosquitoes

options.label: C
options.text: Transovarial transmission - Rickettsia rickettsii in ticks

options.label: D
options.text: Transstadial transmission - Schistosoma hematobium eggs in feces

questions.correct_answer: D. Transstadial transmission - Schistosoma hematobium eggs in feces

questions.text: Hyperventilation in response to a stressful situation leads to which of the following physiological responses?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduction in the blood flow to the brain

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased in the excitability of nerve and muscle cells

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased pH of the arterial blood

options.label: D
options.text: Increased resistance of the pulmonary blood vessels

questions.correct_answer: A. Reduction in the blood flow to the brain

questions.text: When a substance appears in the renal artery but not in the renal vein, which of the following would be true in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Its clearance is equal to the glomerular filtration rate

options.label: B
options.text: Its clearance is equal to the renal plasma flow

options.label: C
options.text: It must be reabsorbed by the kidney

options.label: D
options.text: It must be filtered by the kidney

questions.correct_answer: B. Its clearance is equal to the renal plasma flow

questions.text: All of the following are features of a rash from chicken pox, except:
All of the following are true regarding HCV screening, except:

options.label: A
options.text: IV drug users are more susceptible to infection

options.label: B
options.text: Long term hemodialysis patients are not prone to infection

questions.correct_answer: B. Long term hemodialysis patients are not prone to infection

questions.text: The anti-inflammatory effect of cortisol treatment is thought to be as a result of:
questions.correct_answer: C. Stabilization of cellular lysosomal membranes

questions.text: An incubation period of 28 days is seen with:
Repeated stimulation of a skeletal muscle fiber will result in an increase in contractile strength because repetitive stimulation causes an increase in which one of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Concentration of calcium in the myoplasm

questions.text: Which of the following schedules are correct regarding pre-exposure prophylaxis of Rabies?
The drug regimen recommended for a needle stick injury from a HIV positive patient is which one of the following?`
questions.correct_answer: C. Lamivudine, Tenofovir, Dolutegravir for 4 weeks

questions.text: The criteria for an ideal candidate for IUD insertion includes which one of the following:

options.label: A
options.text: The criteria for an ideal candidate for IUD insertion includes which one of the following:

questions.text: A provision by the State, of medical service and education, but operated and regulated by professional groups, NOT the government would be the definition of which one of the following terms?

A 20-year-old woman presents with complaints that she has heard voices for the past six months. Besides the auditory hallucinations, she says that the radio is giving her special messages. When asked by the meaning of “People in glass houses should not throw stones,” she replies, “Because the windows would break.” Which one of the following mental status findings does this patient appear to display?

A 3-year-old child carries around a tattered, old blanket everywhere he goes. Whenever he is upset, he calms himself by hugging and stroking his blanket. He also requires it to settle down before he goes to sleep. Which one of the following does his blanket represent for this child?

An 18-year-old boy is brought to the ER by his friends after he “took a few pills” at a party and developed symptoms, including his neck twisting to one side, eyes rolling upward, and tongue hanging out of his mouth. He responded immediately to 50 mg of diphenhydramine i/m with the resolution of all physical symptoms. Which one of the following substances is the most likely cause of his symptoms?

A 60-year-old woman slips on the ice and hits her head on the pavement. During the following three weeks, she develops a persistent headache, is increasingly distractible and forgetful, and becomes fearful and disoriented at night. Which one of the following is the most likely cause of these changes?

A 30 week old previously healthy male infant presents with fevers, abdominal distention, feeding intolerance, and bloody stools at 3 weeks of age. The patient undergoes x-ray and ultrasound examination for possible necrotizing enterocolitis. Which of the following findings on imaging is an indication for surgical management?
A neonate is examined in nursery and found to have no anal orifice; only a small perineal fistulous opening is visualized. Which of the following is associated with this abnormality?

A 60 year old man is diagnosed with squamous cell carcinoma to the right internal jugular lymph node chain. Workup including CT and MRI head and neck are negative for a primary malignancy. Which of the following is the next appropriate step in the workup of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Neck ultrasound of the thyroid and bilateral cervical lymph nodes

options.label: D
options.text: Selective sampling of cervical lymph nodes

questions.text: A 15 year old boy is brought to the ER due to nasal fullness and bleeding. Inspection reveals enlarged cervical lymph nodes as well. What viral infection is most likely in this patient?

A 46 year old woman presents to the OPD with a left-sided weakness. CT-head shows a well-circumscribed mass, against the skull in the right hemisphere. Workup of the mass reveals a meningioma. Which one of the following is the most appropriate next step in the treatment of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Preoperative radiation therapy, followed by surgical excision

questions.text: A depressed student severed her own wrist’s radial nerve, in a botched suicide attempt. Which one of the following would be her anticipated disability?

options.label: C
options.text: Wasting of intrinsic muscles of hand

options.label: D
options.text: Thenar pad and thumb web sensory loss

questions.correct_answer: D. Thenar pad and thumb web sensory loss

questions.text: Which one of the following statements regarding nasopharyngeal cancer is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Unusually high incidence among the Chinese

options.label: B
options.text: Wide surgical excision is the TOC

options.label: C
options.text: Occurs primarily after the sixth decade of life

options.label: D
options.text: Undergoes early metastasis to the lungs

questions.correct_answer: A. Unusually high incidence among the Chinese

questions.text: True statements regarding meningiomas include that they

options.label: C
options.text: Are treated primarily by surgical excision

options.label: D
options.text: Are cured, when properly treated, in nearly 95% of cases e. Arise from the dura

questions.correct_answer: C. Are treated primarily by surgical excision

questions.text: Genitourinary tuberculosis in a male patient is suggested by which of the following findings?
Correct statements concerning antiplatelet therapy include

options.label: A
options.text: Aspirin has been shown to be an effective antiplatelet agent

options.label: B
options.text: Most antiplatelet agents work by enhancing prostaglandin synthesis

options.label: C
options.text: Antiplatelet agents have not been shown to increase patency rates of coronary artery bypass grafts

options.label: D
options.text: Aspirin can be used to treat deep venous thrombophlebitis

questions.correct_answer: A. Aspirin has been shown to be an effective antiplatelet agent

questions.text: Conservative management rather than reconstructive arterial surgery is generally recommended for patients with which of the following symptoms or signs of arterial insufficiency?

At the time of operation on a patient, a firm, rubbery lesion in the periphery of the lung is discovered. It is sectioned in the operating room, and reveals tissue that looks like cartilage and smooth muscle. The most likely diagnosis is
A 2-year-old asymptomatic child is noted to have a systolic murmur, hypertension, and dimin- ished femoral pulses. Which of the following is true about this child’s disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: The life expectancy without surgery is about 5 years

options.label: C
options.text: Rib notching is often seen on x-ray

questions.correct_answer: C. Rib notching is often seen on x-ray

questions.text: Which of the following complications are expected to develop in a patient who has undergone a total pancreatectomy?
True statements with regards to hemobilia include which one of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: The classic presentation includes biliary colic, jaundice, and gastrointestinal bleeding

options.label: B
options.text: Spontaneous bleeding secondary to hematologic disorders is the major cause of this disorder

options.label: C
options.text: Angiography has no role in the treatment of intra-hepatic bleeding

options.label: D
options.text: Arterial embolization is advised for hemobilia from the extrahepatic bile ducts

questions.correct_answer: A. The classic presentation includes biliary colic, jaundice, and gastrointestinal bleeding

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions is most likely to require surgical correction?

A 27 year old man comes with complaints of a rash on his chest. He has no other complaints.the rash is not associated with pain or pruritus. He notices the rash has grown slightly over the past few months. He is homosexual and is in a monogamous relationship but he hasnt got himself tested for HIV. What is the patient suffering from?

A 50 year old man talks about changes in the appearance of his skin. He says he has developed thick skin on his hands and face. Sometimes, vesicles and bullae are formed which rupture and there are moist erosions that heal slowly afterward. There has been an increase in hair growth in these areas as well. He was diagnosed with hepatitis C infection which he seemed to have cleared spontaneously 2 years ago. What is the cause of the rash?

A 30 year old is on amoxicillin/clavulanic acid for treatment of supposed bacterial sinusitis. 6 days later she presents with a diffuse itchy rash which has not affected her mucous membranes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents to the Dermatology clinic with acne vulgaris is seeking treatment with isotretinoin. Her acne has been resistant to oral antibiotics and topical treatment. You counsel her regarding the teratogenic effects of this medication. Which other side effect should she be aware of with isotretinoin for the treatment of acne vulgaris?
questions.explanation:
n:
Agent Class Route Frequency Adverse Events
Acitretin Retinoid Oral Daily
  • Teratogenicity
  • Osteophyte formation
  • Hyperlipidemia
  • Flare of inflammatory bowel disease
  • Hepatoxicity
  • Depression

Agent Class Route Frequency Adverse Events
Acitretin Retinoid Oral Daily
  • Teratogenicity
  • Osteophyte formation
  • Hyperlipidemia
  • Flare of inflammatory bowel disease
  • Hepatoxicity
  • Depression

questions.text: True statements about discharge from the nipple include

options.label: A
options.text: Intermittent thin or milky discharge can be physiologic

options.label: B
options.text: Bloody discharge is indicative of an underlying malignancy

options.label: C
options.text: Expressible nipple discharge serves as an indication for open biopsy

options.label: D
options.text: Galactorrhea is indicative of an underlying malignancy

questions.correct_answer: A. Intermittent thin or milky discharge can be physiologic

questions.text: A 20 year old woman with Turner’s syndrome is diagnosed with Hypertension. On further examination, her femoral pulses are delayed as compared to carotid pulses. On auscultation, there was a mid to late systolic murmur. What is the most likely radiological finding?

options.label: C
options.text: An 8 sign due to modelling deformities of the major thoracic blood vessels

options.label: D
options.text: An enlarged external mammary artery on a lateral plain chest x ray

questions.text: Which of the following strongly suggests the diagnosis of primary hyperparathyroidism?

A 59 year old woman with rheumatoid arthritis presents with flu-like symptoms. She also has a non-productive cough. She was put on a round of broad spectrum antibodies, to no effect. An HRCT is ordered, which shows widespread mosaic perfusion in the lungs. How can you differentiate between obliterative bronchiolitis rather than diffuse pulmonary hemorrhage?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced pulmonary vessel calibre in the hyperattenuated area

options.label: B
options.text: Reduced pulmonary vessel calibre in the hypoattenuated area

options.label: C
options.text: Normal pulmonary vessel calibre in the hyperattenuated area

options.label: D
options.text: Increased pulmonary vessel calibre in the hypoattenuated area

questions.correct_answer: B. Reduced pulmonary vessel calibre in the hypoattenuated area

questions.text: When galactorrhea occurs in a high school student, a diagnostic associated finding would be
A cross-match is performed by incubating

options.label: A
options.text: Donor serum with recipient lymphocytes and complement

options.label: B
options.text: Donor lymphocytes with recipient serum and complement

options.label: D
options.text: Recipient serum with a known panel of multiple donor lymphocytes

questions.correct_answer: B. Donor lymphocytes with recipient serum and complement

questions.text: Rapid fluid resuscitation of the hypovolemic patient after abdominal trauma is significantly enhanced by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Placement of long 18-gauge subclavian vein catheters

options.label: B
options.text: Placement of percutaneous femoral vein catheters

options.label: D
options.text: Placement of short, large-bore percutaneous peripheral intravenous catheters

questions.correct_answer: D. Placement of short, large-bore percutaneous peripheral intravenous catheters

questions.text: A 3-year-old man complains of 1 week of dizziness, vertigo, tinnitus, and right-sided gait ataxia. Electronystagmography (calorics) with sequential administration of warm and cold water into the ear canal is performed. On the left, cold water causes right-beating nystagmus and warm water causes left-beating nystagmus. On the right ear, there is no response to the cold caloric. What is the cause of this patient’s dizziness and vertigo?

A 72 year old man with increasing hoarseness and difficulty swallowing solids comes to the OPD. He has a history of smoking for the past 10 years and also tobacco ingestion. He is suspected to have laryngeal carcinoma limited to the supraglottis. All of the following supraglottic subsites are affected by the disease except:
questions.explanation:
Sites Subsites
Supraglottic

Suprahyoid epiglottis Infrahyoid epiglottis ArytenoidsAryepiglottic folds with the cuneiform and corniculatecartilages Vestibular fold

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding spasmodic dysphonia?

options.label: A
options.text: It’s only a local laryngeal disorder

options.label: C
options.text: In the Adductor type, the voice becomes strangled

options.label: D
options.text: In the adductor type, the spasm of the cricoarytenoid muscle causes the glottis to be kept open

questions.correct_answer: C. In the Adductor type, the voice becomes strangled

questions.text: A 27 year old man presented to the clinic with difficulty in breathing. On examination a painless, nasopharyngeal mass was detected which made a suspicion of Angiofibroma. Which of the following statements about Angiofibroma is not true?

options.label: B
options.text: It’s a benign tumor with no local invasion

options.label: C
options.text: It arises from the sphenopalatine foramen and the investigation of choice for diagnosis is HRCT

options.label: D
options.text: The tumour is said to be testosterone dependent

questions.correct_answer: B. It’s a benign tumor with no local invasion

questions.text: A 23 year old man comes to the ER with a two day history of severe epigastric pain which is accompanied by vomiting. The pain has seemed to increase a lot in duration and quantity as well. He has been constipated since then but he has passed flatus. The patient is usually in a good condition with no history of any disease. But he consumes 150 units of alcohol per week. Upon further investigations, his White blood cell count is elevated along with serum amylase levels. Abdominal x-ray showed a single small bowel segment dilatation in the central abdominal region. Identify the image associated with this radiographic finding?

A 12 year old girl from a rural area entered the PHC with nasal discharge which was extremely foul smelling. She complained of recurrent epistaxis and on examination there was a lot of nasal crusting present. In addition there was also the presence of maggots in the nasal cavity. All of the following can be used in the treatment of the same except:

options.label: A
options.text: All visible maggots should be extracted by forceps

questions.text: True about EFFECTIVE DOSE:

options.label: A
options.text: used to estimate the non-biologic effects of radiation and is expressed in millisieverts (mSv).

options.label: B
options.text: used to estimate the non-biologic effects of radiation and is expressed in centigray (cGy)

options.label: C
options.text: used to estimate the biologic effects of radiation and is expressed in centigray (cGy).

options.label: D
options.text: used to estimate the biologic effects of radiation and is expressed in millisieverts (mSv).

questions.correct_answer: D. used to estimate the biologic effects of radiation and is expressed in millisieverts (mSv).

questions.text: A 39 year old man with a previous history of Ménière’s disease presented to the ER with a history of sudden fall while standing in the kitchen without loss of consciousness. On arrival the patient had no focal deficit, his cardiovascular signs were also within normal range. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 24 year old man comes to the OPD with complaints of swelling of his right knee which is increasing progressively. He got the injury following a football match some weeks ago. A radiograph was ordered which showed a 6 cm ill-defined lytic lesion within the right distal femoral metaphysis. There is a permeative pattern of bone loss and there were areas of ossifications with a cloud like appearance. Furthermore, there is a periosteal reaction, mostly focused perpendicular to the cortex. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 44 year old female comes to the OPD with a past medical history of shoulder pain accompanied with stiffness. Now the pain has flared up more intensely even at night times. She denies any trauma to her shoulder or any other illness per say. Upon further investigations, she has decreased active and passive range of motion. All of the conditions are associated with frozen shoulders except?

A 24 year old fitness trainer who regularly lifts heavy weights and works out more than 2 hours per day presented to the clinic with complaints of inability to squat, associated pain as and when he tries to squat or any other leg exercises. He has a history of regular intake of steroids and creatine over the last few months. His x ray is given below: What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Avascular necrosis of head of femur

options.label: D
options.text: Fracture of posterior lip of the acetabulum

questions.correct_answer: B. Avascular necrosis of head of femur

questions.text: A 22 year old man comes to the OPD with severe back pain, fever and unintentional weight loss for the past month. On a physical exam, he has a kyphotic deformity present on his back. What is not true about the management of Pott’s paraplegia?

options.label: A
options.text: Paraplegia not improving with conservative treatment even after 3–6 weeks is an indication for operative intervention

options.label: B
options.text: Posterior decompression and instrumentation can be used to correct the deformity

options.label: C
options.text: Chemotherapy is the mainstay of conservative management

options.label: D
options.text: Decompression via anterolateral approach is most preferred

questions.correct_answer: B. Posterior decompression and instrumentation can be used to correct the deformity

questions.text: Rinne’s test showed positive result on left side and negative result on right side & Weber’s test showed lateralization to left side in a 38-year-old male who came with a c/o of decrease in hearing ability. Your probable diagnosis would be:
All of the following are features of Mongoloid definition except:
IPC section 85 states that:

options.label: A
options.text: Child under 7 years is not liable for act

options.label: B
options.text: A person of unsound mind s not liable for the act

options.label: C
options.text: A person who is under involuntary intoxication and commits a crime is not liable for the act

options.label: D
options.text: A person who is under voluntary intoxication and commits a crime is liable for the act.

questions.correct_answer: C. A person who is under involuntary intoxication and commits a crime is not liable for the act
questions.explanation:
Sec 82 IPC Criminal responsibility of person <7 years = not liable
Sec 83 IPC Criminal responsibility of person 7-12 years = liability depends on the mental maturity
Sec 84 IPC Criminal responsibility of insane person = not liable
Sec 85 IPC Criminal responsibility of involuntary drunkenness = not liable(intoxicating substance is given without the knowledge of the person)
Sec 86 IPC Criminal responsibility of voluntary drunkenness = liable (intoxicating substance is taken with intent

questions.text: Which of the following statements is correct about the use of this given instrument? 1) Harvesting Temporalis fascia 2) Self-retaining and hemostatic. 3) In mastoidectomy to retract soft tissues after incision 4) Helps in removal of bone
All of the following are tests for cessation of respiration except:
You receive the body of a 38- year-old male for autopsy. During the procedure you are seeing the finding as shown in the image below. The following appearance is seen at what range?
Identify the wrong pair with the condition and its appropriate colour of Post mortem staining:
questions.explanation:
Condition Colour of Post mortem staining
Usual colour Reddish purple
CO Cherry red
HCN Bright Red or Dark Red or Brick Red
Hypothermia, drowning Bright Pink
Opium Black
Nitrites, Nitrates, potassium chlorate, Potassium bicarbonate, nitrobenzene, acetanilide, bromates, Aniline Red Brown or Copper Brown or Chocolate Brown or Coffee Brown
Hydrogen Sulphide Bluish-green
CO2, Asphyxia, Aniline Deep blue (In Aniline Deep blue as well as Red Brown colour can occur)
Clostridium Perfringens Bronze

questions.text: A 30 year old female complains of lower extremity weakness for the last 5 days. She says there has been progressive weakness with loss of sensation starting below the belly button and she is also experiencing urinary incontinence. Past medical history is unremarkable. Physical examination shows a sensory level at the level of the umbilicus. The lower extremities show strength bilaterally proximally and distally. Reflexes, cerebellar examinations are normal. All the following are appropriate steps in evaluating this patient except
The toxic principle of this plant is:-

On a neurologic consultation , you are asked to evaluate a patient with mesial temporal lobe epilepsy syndrome. The patient has a history of intractable complex partial seizures that rarely generalize. Her seizures often begin with an aura and commonly manifest as behavioral arrests and unilateral posturing. On further examination, MRI reveals small temporal lobes and a small hippocampus. Which of these is likely to be present in this patient?

A 66 year old man comes to the OPD with his wife. She says that over the past 2 months he’s had slowed thinking and a changed personality in the sense that he’s very withdrawn. The patient's history is negligible except a mild but persistent headache which is diffuse. There is no past family history of neurological disorders or psychiatric disorders. A mini mental examination score is 18/30. His head CT is shown in Figure. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21 year old woman is brought to the emergency department after a generalized tonic-clonic seizure confirmed by bystanders. She has no identifying information on herself , and her past medical history is unknown. What is the most likely cause of her seizure?
CLED medium is used in the preference to MacConkey agar in relation to culture of organisms involved in urine infection. The reason is

options.label: B
options.text: Differentiates Lactose Forming and Non- Lactose Forming

questions.correct_answer: C. Promotes Staphylococcus, Streptococcus and Candida

questions.text: A 64 year old male presents with severe right sided eye and facial pain, nausea, vomiting, colored halos around lights, and loss of visual acuity. His right eye is quite red, and that pupil is dilated and fixed. Which of the following diagnostic tests would confirm the diagnosis?
True regarding thymus is:

options.label: A
options.text: Mature thymocytes express CD 4 and CD 8

options.label: B
options.text: Thymocytes whose T-cell receptor bind with high affinity to self-antigens and MHC Complexes are clonally deleted

options.label: C
options.text: Mature thymocytes express surface IgM and IgD

options.label: D
options.text: CD 4 and CD 8 double positive cells are completely eliminated by a process of negative selection.

questions.correct_answer: B. Thymocytes whose T-cell receptor bind with high affinity to self-antigens and MHC Complexes are clonally deleted

questions.text: A 33 year old male with a past medical history of end stage renal disease is currently on hemodialysis. He was on a stable hemodialysis regimen for 8 years, and all his electrolytes are normal. He is having complaints of decreased libido, inability to maintain erections and mild weakness. Further examination reveals a decrease in serum testosterone level. Measurement of which of the following will distinguish primary from secondary hypogonadism?
Phylum Apicomplexa contains-
Flagella are microscopic hair-like structures involved in the locomotion of a cell. Which of the following is a motile organism?

A 24 year old woman presents with 2 weeks of nausea, vomiting, and jaundice. She has been previously healthy and has no past medical history. On examination, a palpable liver edge is appreciated. Ocular findings are shown in the image. Her transaminases and total bilirubin are elevated. Which of the following tests will lead to a definitive diagnosis in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Liver biopsy with quantitative copper assa

questions.text: A patient with AIDS had an acute episode of diarrhea. The stool examination revealed an oval structure (8 to 9ù in diameter) that was acid-fast and fluorescent blue under ultraviolet light. The most likely identification of this organism is?

A 16 year old presents to the ER with a headache which has worsened since the past 2 months. His parents said that he has been perfectly fine until this incident and that since then he hasn’t seemed like himself and over the past 2 weeks he has complained of double vision. He had an episode of profuse vomiting this afternoon, which prompted his visit. He also describes weight gain over the same 2 month time period and has not been sleeping well. On examination, he is drowsy, and a funduscopic examination reveals papilledema. He has no fever, neck stiffness, or elevated white blood cell count. What is the most likely cause?

A 61 year old woman comes to the OPD for evaluation of hypercalcemia of 12.8 mg/dL which was an incidental find on a chemistry panel that was done during a hospitalization for cervical trauma which was operated 7 weeks ago. Despite fluid administration in the hospital, her serum calcium at discharge was 11.8 mg/dL. She has no other complaints. On further tests, her serum calcium level is 12.4 mg/dL, and phosphate is 2.3 mg/dL. Her hematocrit and all other chemistries including creatinine were normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 62 year old woman arrives at the OPD complaining of fatigue and lethargy over a period of 6 months. She describes dry skin and has noted that she is losing hair. On examination she is mildly bradycardic at 52 beats/min with normal blood pressure and has dry, coarse skin.Which is the most likely clinical diagnosis and which test would be indicated for screening for the diagnosis?

A Brazilian immigrant is hired at a meat packing plant and undergoes a physical examination. Chest X-ray shows a patchy bilateral pneumonia and a lung mass. Biopsy of the mass shows fungal organisms with a few very distinctive ‘pilot’s wheel’ yeast forms. What is the most likely diagnosis-

A 50 year old male presents to the clinic for a routine health examination. A comprehensive metabolic panel shows a serum calcium level of 11.2 mg/dL. Serum phosphate is 3.0 mg/dL. Serum creatinine is normal. He denies bone pain, lethargy, weakness, or weight loss. What is the MC cause of hypercalcemia?

A 27 year old female with SLE is in remission and her treatment currently is azathioprine 70 mg/d and prednisone 5 mg/d. Previous year she had a life-threatening exacerbation of the disease. She now wants to get pregnant. Which among the following is the least appropriate advice?

options.label: A
options.text: Advise her about high risk of spontaneous abortion

options.label: B
options.text: Warn her that exacerbations may occur in the first trimester and also in the postpartum period.

options.label: C
options.text: Inform her that it is unlikely that the newborn will have lupus.

options.label: D
options.text: Stop the prednisone just before she attempts to become pregnant.

questions.correct_answer: D. Stop the prednisone just before she attempts to become pregnant.

questions.text: A 48 year old male has a long-standing history of ankylosing spondylitis. His most recent spinal film shows straightening of the lumbar spine, loss of lordosis, and “squaring” of the vertebral bodies. He currently is limited by pain with ambulation that is not improved with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medications. Which of these treatments has been shown to improve symptoms?

A 30-years-old male presented with discrete hypopigmented macules on his upper back, on examination of skin scrapings with 10% KOH under microscope spaghetti and meatball appearance was seen, for which Selenium sulfide is indicated as a treatment by the physician. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 64 year old man with coronary artery disease and atrial fibrillation comes to the OPD for evaluation of fevers, arthralgias, pleuritis, and malar rash. These symptoms have developed over the past 6 months. The pleuritis has responded to steroid therapy, but prednisone has been unable to be tapered off due to recurrence of symptoms at daily steroid doses <15 mg of prednisone. His medications include aspirin, procainamide, lovastatin, prednisone, and carvedilol. You suspect drug-induced lupus due to procainamide. Antibodies directed against which of the following proteins is most likely to be positive?

A patient visited the hospital with non-specific symptoms like fever, mild cough, rashes, etc. On further examination and testing, the physician is suspecting it to be an arboviral infection. Which of the following is true regarding arboviral infections?

options.label: A
options.text: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome is caused by inhalation of rodent feces

options.label: B
options.text: KFD is caused by the bite of wild animal

options.label: C
options.text: Lyssa virus is transmitted by ticks

options.label: D
options.text: Yellow fever is transmitted by Anopheles mosquito

questions.correct_answer: A. Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome is caused by inhalation of rodent feces

questions.text: A 29 year old male with a history of episodic abdominal pain ,stress-induced edema of lips and the tongue is likely to have low functional or absolute levels of which of the following proteins?

A 45 year old male is hospitalized in the ICU for postsurgical complications after gastrojejunal bypass surgery for several weeks . He is having persistent fevers and on examination is found to have erythema, fluctuance, and tenderness over the posterior surface of the left elbow. Initial management of this disorder should include all the following except

options.label: C
options.text: aspiration of the collection for Gram stain and culture

options.label: D
options.text: microscopic evaluation of aspirate for crystals

questions.text: A 32 year old pregnant woman presents to OPD with thumb and wrist pain which has worsened over the last few weeks. She experiences pain when she pinches her thumb against her other fingers. On physical examination she has mild swelling and tenderness over the radial styloid process, and pain is elicited when she places her thumb in her palm and grasps it with her fingers. A Phalen maneuver is negative. Which condition is most likely?

options.label: C
options.text: Gouty arthritis of the first metacarpophalangeal joint

questions.text: True about Corynebacterium diphtheriae are all except:

options.label: A
options.text: Iron is not required for toxin production

options.label: B
options.text: Toxin production is responsible for local reaction

options.label: D
options.text: Toxin production is by lysogenic conversion

questions.correct_answer: A. Iron is not required for toxin production

questions.text: A 35 year old male came to the OPD with yellowing of eyes. He states that he has had similar episodes of yellow eyes lasting to 3 4 days 10 years ago too. He does not have any nausea, pain in abdomen, dark urine or light-colored stools, itching or any unintentional weight loss. He did not seek prior medical attention because of finances and spontaneous remission of yellowing of eyes. On examination he is mildly obese. On physical examination, abdomen is soft and nontender, and there is no organomegaly. Laboratory examinations show total bilirubin of 3 mg/dL, Direct bilirubin is 0.2 mg/dL. LFT is normal. Which is the most likely diagnosis?
Which drug is used to treat NARST (Nalidixic acid resistant S.typhi)?

Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) may be caused by exogenous factors. Gastrointestinal flora may promote an inflammatory response or may inhibit inflammation. Probiotics have been used to treat IBD. Which of the following organisms has been used in the treatment of IBD?

An 84 year old female is brought to the emergency department due to lethargy. At home, she had blood pressure of 85/60 mmHg, heart rate 101 beats/min, temperature 37.8°C. Laboratory data show : sodium 137 meq/L, potassium 2.8 meq/L, HCO3 – 8 meq/L, chloride 117 meq/L, BUN 17 mg/dL, creatinine 0.9 mg/dL. An arterial blood gas shows PaO2 80 mmHg, PCO2 24 mmHg, pH 7.29. Her urine analysis is clear and has a pH of 4.5. What is the acid-base disorder?

options.label: C
options.text: Non-anion-gap metabolic acidosis and respiratory alkalosis

questions.text: A 57 year old man is admitted to the hospital for dehydration and confusion. In the emergency department he complained of excessive thirst and he was found to have a serum sodium of 162 meq/L and a newly elevated creatinine of 2.2 mg/dL. After receiving IV fluid, his sensorium clears and the patient tells you that he drinks large amounts of fluid each day and makes about 2 L of urine each day. He has noticed that his urine output has no relation to the amount of fluid he drinks. His sodium remains elevated at 150 meq/L, and his urine osmolality returns at 80 mosmol/kg. After appropriate water restriction, you administer 10 µg of desmopressin intranasally and remeasure his urine osmolality. The osmolality is 94 mosmol/kg. Identify the most likely cause of hypernatremia in this patent?

A 44 year old woman wants treatment for her irregular menstrual cycles associated with heavy menstrual bleeding. In the past 6 months, her cycles have been 22–25 days associated with heavy bleeding which was unusual for her. She hasnt had any significant hot flashes. You suspect perimenopausal disorder and order hormonal testing for the same which is suggestive of the same. You are considering treatment with OCP's to control her symptoms. All of the following would be considered contraindications to use of oral contraceptive pills except

options.label: E
options.text: prior history of deep venous thrombosis

questions.text: Building a tower of six cubes by a 24-month-old child requires?

options.label: D
options.text: able to link actions to solve problems

questions.explanation:
Age Gross motor Fine motor Language
24 months Walks up and downstairs (2 feet/step)Jumps Tower of 6 blocksDraws vertical and circular strokeTurns the pages of a book one page at a time Puts 3 words together (subject, verb, object)
36 months Rides a tricycle, can steer and pedalAlternate feet going upstairs Can build a tower with 9 blocksCan copy circleCan dress and undress fully Knows full name,age and sex
48 months Hopes on one footAlternate feet going DownstairsThrows ball overhand Copies cross Tells story

questions.text: A 54 year old lady with a past medical history of a compression fracture of T4 vertebral body comes to the endocrinologist for evaluation of osteoporosis. She is experiencing perimenopausal symptoms like irregular menstrual periods and hot flashes. She is otherwise healthy. A bone mineral density scan demonstrates a T score of –3.5 SD and a Z score of –2.5 SD All of the tests are indicated for evaluating osteoporosis except ?

options.label: A
options.text: follicle-stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone levels

questions.correct_answer: A. follicle-stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone levels

questions.text: A 7 year old boy presented with recurrent eye blinking behavior and recurrent extension of extremities,mother describes the movement as sudden, rapid, and repetitive movements,it was present the nine months. Of the following ,the MOST appropriate diagnosis is

A 25 year old female with increasing facial hair and acne for the past 4 months comes to the OPD as she has noticed some deepening of her voice. On Examination, she is having moderate obesity without abdominal striae or bruising. All steps would be important initial steps in the diagnosis except?

A 13 year old adolescent female came to the OPD with complaints of feeling fat especially over stomach area and thighs. She also feels cold, tired,weak,and is lacking energy. Examination shows ,heart rate 46 beats/min,blood pressure70/40mmHg, weight below average , dry skin,and lanugo-type hair growth on face; lab investigation point towards hypokalemia and hypophosphatemia. What will be the MOST appropriate next step is
Which of the following therapies have NOT shown to reduce the risk of hip fractures in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis
The Behavioral Changes In attention deficit hyperactivity disorder(ADHD) should met all the following criteria EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: developmentally inappropriately far comparing with other children of the same age

options.label: C
options.text: must be present for at least for 6 mo

options.label: D
options.text: must be present in 2 or more settings

questions.correct_answer: B. must begin before age 6 yr

questions.text: A 23 year old pregnant woman at 24 weeks gestation presents to the ER with pain in her abdomen. Her symptoms started about 7 hours prior to presentation and she has no diarrhea. She has nausea and vomiting. Her pain started from the periumbilical area and is now radiating to the flanks. On examination, Temperature = 100.3°C, BP =129/90 mmHg, HR= 105 beats/ min, P/A there is mild abdominal tenderness. Her os is closed and her obstetric history is fine. Fetal monitoring shows a normal FHR . WBC count is 10,000/µL. Urine analysis shows 2 WBC per high powered field, no epithelial cells, and 1 red blood cell per high powered field. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3 month baby of a keen and highly educated family presented with a history of URTl followed by deterioration of level of consciousness and seizure. CT brain shows intracranial bleeding with no evidence of skull fracture. Fundoscopy was normal. Mother gives a history of difficult labour but with normal development, mild hypotonia, and macrocephaly which was reassured initially by the general Pediatrician. The MOST likely diagnosis is :

A 47 year-old woman has achieved a pregnancy via in vitro fertlization (IVF) using donor eggs from a 21-year-old woman and sperm from her 46- year-old husband. She has a sonogram performed at 6 weeks gestational age that shows a twin pregnancy. A subsequent sonogram at 12 weeks shows a 5-mm nuchal fold is discovered in one of the embryos. What does this imply?

options.label: A
options.text: The embryo has a high risk of a neural tube defect.

options.label: B
options.text: The embryo has a high risk of cardiac malformation.

options.label: C
options.text: Such a nuchal fold is normal and there are no implications to the fetus.

options.label: D
options.text: The embryo has an abnormal karyotype with the most likely diagnosis of Turner syndrome

questions.correct_answer: B. The embryo has a high risk of cardiac malformation.

questions.text: Zinc Deficiency Associated With increased risk for all the following EXCEPT
questions.correct_answer: D. increased risk for skin infections

questions.text: A 31 year old G1P0 presents to your office at 22 weeks gestaton seeking a second opinion. She was informed her baby has a birth defect. The ultrasound image is given below. Which is the most likely defect?

An 8 month old child who was previously well presented with vomiting and an altered conscious level. A CT head reveals significant hydrocephalus with a hyperdense mass. An MRI was arranged and it revealed a lobulated mass adjacent to the trigone of the lateral ventricle. This lesion yields low signal on both T1W and T2W sequences with enhancement. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents to the OPD at term with no prenatal care. An ultrasound is performed and shows the fetus to be in the third trimester and to have multiple congenital anomalies, including microcephaly, cardiac anomalies, and growth retardation. Which of the following substances has she abused during her pregnancy?
The majority of poisoning in children arise from ingestion, but exposures can also occur via inhalational, dermal, and ocular route. All the following are true about decontamination EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: the goal is to minimize absorption of the toxic substance

options.label: B
options.text: decontamination should be routinely employed for every poisoned patient

options.label: C
options.text: water should not be used for decontamination after exposure to phosphorus

options.label: D
options.text: the efficacy of the intervention decreases with increasing time since exposure

questions.correct_answer: B. decontamination should be routinely employed for every poisoned patient

questions.text: A 25-year-old G1P0 at 37 weeks gestational age comes to the OPD for a routine obstetric (OB) visit. She complains of dizziness, light headedness, and feeling of syncope as and when she tries to lie down. What is the next step of management for this patient ?

options.label: B
options.text: Monitor for 24 hrs with a Holter monitor to rule out an arrhythmia.

options.label: C
options.text: Do an arterial blood gas analysis.

options.label: D
options.text: Reassure her and encourage her not to lie flat on her back.

questions.correct_answer: C. Do an arterial blood gas analysis.

questions.text: A 26-year-old G1P0 patient at 34 weeks gestation is being evaluated intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR). She has a history of smokingThe Doppler USG studies show that the S/D ratio in the umbilical arteries is much higher compared to her last ultrasound 3 weeks ago also there is now a reverse diastolic flow. Which of the following is correct statement?

options.label: A
options.text: The Doppler USG studies indicate that fetus is okay

options.label: B
options.text: With advancing gestational age the S/D ratio is supposed to rise.

options.label: C
options.text: These Doppler findings are in fact normal in someone who smokes.

options.label: D
options.text: The Doppler studies are worrisome and indicate that the fetal status is deteriorating.

questions.correct_answer: D. The Doppler studies are worrisome and indicate that the fetal status is deteriorating.

questions.text: A 28 year old G1P0 presents to OPD at 24 weeks gestational age with right-sided groin pain which is sharp and occurring with movement and exercise. Relief is attained by using a heating pad. On examination, she is healthy and has no fever or chills.What is the most likely etiology of this pain?

A 34-year-old G2P1 at 31 weeks gestation with a known placenta previa presents to the hospital with vaginal bleeding. On assessment, she has normal vital signs and the fetal heart rate tracing is 140 beats per minute with accelerations and no decelerations. No uterine contractions are demonstrated on external tocometer. Heavy vaginal bleeding is noted. Which is the best next step in the management of this patient
questions.correct_answer: C. Admit and stabilize the patient.

questions.text: A 72 year old G5P5 presents to comes to the OPD for a routine checkup. Her last checkup was 6 years ago, when she turned 64. She has a history of hypertension for which she takes diuretics. Which is the best vaccination to recommend for this patient?

A 50-year-old G4P4 presents for her well-woman examination. She had one cesarean delivery followed by three vaginal deliveries. Her menses stopped 1 year ago and she occasionally still has hot flashes. She tells you that about 10 years ago she was treated with a laser conization for carcinoma in situ of her cervix. Since that time, all of her Pap tests have been normal. What recommendation should you make regarding how frequently she should undergo Pap smear testing?

At an anganwadi centre, the ASHA worker is demonstrating technique of insertion and teaching about use of barrier contraceptives for women to a group of village women. She explains that the Vaginal diaphragm should be removed
questions.explanation:
Vaginal diaphragm

  • After intercourse, the vaginal diaphragm and vault cap should not be removed before 6–8 h of the last act and should not be kept for more than 24 h.
  • Best time to introduce it is from a few minutes to 2 h before the sexual act,
  • Spermicides must be used along with these devices.
  • Contraindications

?-? Prolapse, cystocele, rectocele because accurate fitting is not possible;

?-? Recurrent urinary tract infection and

?-? Allergy to rubber or spermicidal agent.

  • Toxic shock syndrome (TSS) may occur if the diaphragm is left in the vagina for a long periodRef: William’s Textbook of Gynecology, 3E, Pg no: 131

questions.text: A 54 year old woman presents for a routine visit. On examination, there is an enlarged, tender right adnexal mass. You order a pelvic ultrasound as the next step in the patient’s evaluation. Which of the following conditions of the cyst would suggest further evaluation for a possible ovarian malignancy?

options.label: B
options.text: The presence of a unilocular cyst in one ovary

options.label: C
options.text: Papillary vegetations within a cystic ovary

options.label: D
options.text: An ovarian cyst with a diameter of 4 cm

questions.correct_answer: C. Papillary vegetations within a cystic ovary

questions.text: The depicted instrument can be used for all of the following procedures except?
Identify:
Following picture represent which obstetric grips during palpation

A 26 year old G0P0 comes to the OPD describing hirsuitism. Her menstrual history is such that her menses started at age 13 were very irregular. Her menses occur every 2-6 months She also complains of acne and is currently seeing a dermatologist for the skin condition. She denies any medical problems. On physical examination, there is less hair around the nipples, the chin, and upper lip. No thyromegaly or temporal balding is noted. Pelvic examination appears normal with no evidence of clitoromegaly. How will you best describe the patients condition?

options.label: D
options.text: Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor of the ovary

questions.text: A 55 year old male, with a severe mental deficiency, is brought in for a checkup. His sister has the same affliction. According to his family history, their parents are deceased but had normal intelligence and no chronic disorders. The man sits as though he is sewing. On obtaining a ferric chloride test on the patient’s urine, the test turns color with aromatic (ring) compounds, including specific amino acids. Green color confirms the diagnosis. Among the amino acids given below, which of the was most likely detected in the patient’s urine?
Myoglobin, a globular protein, is the oxygen carrier of muscles. Which one of the following amino acids is likely to be present within the interior of the molecule of such a protein?

A cyanosis child, who has recently drunk well-water and thus has reduced hemoglobin, can be treated with a soft drink. Hemoglobin’s ability to serve as an effective transporter of oxygen and carbon dioxide between lungs and tissues is explained by which one of the following of its properties?

options.label: A
options.text: Hb binds proportionately more O2 at low oxygen tension than myoglobin.

options.label: B
options.text: α- and β-globin chains of Hb have very different primary structures, than myoglobin.

options.label: C
options.text: Hemoglobin uses oxidized ferric iron to bind oxygen, myoglobin uses ferrous.

options.label: D
options.text: Hb shows greater changes in secondary and tertiary structures, after oxygen binding, compared to myoglobin

questions.correct_answer: D. Hb shows greater changes in secondary and tertiary structures, after oxygen binding, compared to myoglobin

questions.text: Which of the following are products of TAG breakdown and subsequent β-oxidation that may undergo gluconeogenesis?

A 16 year old college student presented to the OPD with complaints of becoming flushed and nauseated after his first drink of alcohol. It is learned that this is due to a genetic variation in some Asians and Native Americans that affects metabolism of a metabolite of alcohol. The variably degraded metabolite would be which of the following?

Some organic acidemias or fatty acid oxidation disorders will also involve elevated ammonia. This is related to the location of reactions of the urea cycle, which occurs in which one of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: In the mitochondrial matrix and the cytosol

questions.correct_answer: D. In the mitochondrial matrix and the cytosol

questions.text: A 34-year-old G2P1 at 31 weeks gestation with a known placenta previa presents to the hospital with vaginal bleeding. On assessment, she has normal vital signs and the fetal heart rate tracing is 140 beats per minute with accelerations and no decelerations. No uterine contractions are demonstrated on external tocometer. Heavy vaginal bleeding is noted. Which is the best next step in the management of this patient
questions.correct_answer: C. Admit and stabilize the patient.
